TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MembershipCreateUserException extends System.Exception

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a user is not successfully created by a membership provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the MembershipCreateUserException class is thrown when a <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> operation fails.
> [!NOTE] > If you are not familiar with the membership features of ASP.NET, see [Introduction to Membership](../Topic/Introduction%20to%20Membership.md) before continuing. For a list of other topics related to membership, see [Managing Users by Using Membership](../Topic/Managing%20Users%20by%20Using%20Membership.md).
The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property indicates the reason for the exception so you can handle it appropriately.
## Examples The following code example creates a new user for an ASP.NET application configured to use forms authentication and ASP.NET membership. If the user is not created successfully, the code catches the MembershipCreateUserException and displays the message specified in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This example contains a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](../Topic/Script%20Exploits%20Overview.md).
[!code-vb[System.Web.Security.Membership#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.security.me_5_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Security.Membership#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.security.me_5_1.aspx)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method when the user is not created.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.security.me_25_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.security.me_25_1.aspx)]

Docs.param: A description of the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the property to the supplied parameter value

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method when the user is not created.
You can use the `message` parameter to set the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the exception to a meaningful description of the reason for the exception.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown with a message based on the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.security.me_24_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.security.me_24_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus statusCode) cil managed

Docs.param: A enumeration value that describes the reason for the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method when the user is not created.
The `statusCode` parameter enables you to indicate why the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> was thrown. The `statusCode` parameter value is exposed by the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown with the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException.StatusCode%2A> returned by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/276353a4-1865-46cd-8716-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/276353a4-1865-46cd-8716-_1.aspx)]

## Remarks This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [XML and SOAP Serialization](../Topic/XML%20and%20SOAP%20Serialization.md).
## Examples The following code example shows an implementation of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class that calls the protected constructor of the base class with the supplied serialization information and context.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the property to the supplied and the property to the supplied .

remarks.format:
## Remarks An instance of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> class is thrown by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method when the user is not created.
You can use this overload of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> constructor to supply information regarding a caught exception that occurred while the user was being created.
## Examples The following code example calls the <xref:System.Web.Security.Membership.CreateUser%2A> method to create a new membership user. If the user creation fails, a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> is thrown. If the exception is not a <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException>, the caught exception is supplied as the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> that is thrown.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/8bcaebb4-9158-484c-ab86-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/8bcaebb4-9158-484c-ab86-_1.aspx)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Any objects included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.

Docs.summary: Gets a description of the reason for the exception.
Docs.value: A enumeration value that describes the reason for the exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The StatusCode property enables you to determine why the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> was thrown and respond accordingly.
## Examples The following code example creates a new user for an ASP.NET application configured to use forms authentication and ASP.NET membership. If the user is not created successfully, the code catches the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateUserException> and displays the message specified in the StatusCode property.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Security.Membership#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.security.me_3_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Security.Membership#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.security.me_3_1.aspx)]
